description: Android 4.0 allows drag and drop of views. Lars Vogel shows you in detail how to do this.
title: Drag & Drop in Android 4.0

description: This tutorial shows how to use fragment-based designs to create a modular user interface for both, mobiles and tablets.
title: Working With Fragments
Augmented Reality basics: Accessing camera & compass

description: Todd David has released an UI component that visualizes progress without a progress bar.
title: Another progress visualization

description: GreenDao is an ORM that maps Java classes directly onto SQLite tables. No more tedious SQL wrapping.
title: Android ORM for SQLite

description: With Chrome for Android Google has released a very fast and solid browser. One benefit for those who do web development is that it's update cycle is now decoupled from the Android OS update cycle.
title: Chrome beta for Android

description: Romain Nurik has released Android Design Preview, a little utility for Mac/Windows/Linux that'll mirror a portion of your desktop screen (such as your Photoshop canvas) to your USB-connected Android device.
title: Android Design Preview

description: Terminal IDE is an expandable terminal application, with a full Java / HTML / Android development kit, that runs on your Android device.
title: Terminal IDE
